question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Pay attention to ensure that the code you generate is executable and can be displayed. Regenerate the following for the General Manager:

General Manager:
- View and manage personnel records
- View and manage customer information
- View and manage order details
- View and manage production plans
- View and manage material inventory
- Review system information

checklist.title: Is the personnel management system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements CRUD operations for personnel records, including employee information display, search filtering, role-based access control, and audit logging. Score 0 if the core functionality is missing, 5 if only basic operations are implemented, and 10 if comprehensive personnel management features (including performance tracking, organizational chart visualization, and approval workflows) are included.

checklist.title: Is the customer information management system properly designed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the customer management module includes contact details, purchase history, segmentation, and relationship management features. Check if the system implements data validation, duplicate detection, and privacy compliance measures. Deduct 3 points for missing search/filter functionality, 3 points for inadequate data validation, and 4 points for lack of customer segmentation features. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the order management functionality comprehensively implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the order management system includes order creation, status tracking, invoice generation, and history visualization. Evaluate if it supports filtering by date ranges, customers, and status. Deduct 3 points if there's no order analytics dashboard, 3 points if there's no order status workflow visualization, and 4 points if there's no integration between orders and customer profiles. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the production planning and inventory management features fully functional?
checklist.description: Review the implementation of production scheduling, material requirements planning, and inventory tracking systems. Check for visualizations like Gantt charts for production timelines and alert mechanisms for low inventory. Deduct 3 points for missing timeline visualizations, 3 points for lack of automatic inventory adjustment from orders, and 4 points if there's no forecasting capability based on historical data. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid input, network interruption, concurrent access conflicts, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Real-time business analytics dashboard 2. Customizable reporting engine 3. AI-driven forecasting for sales and inventory). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple data retrieval methods doing the same thing) 2. Function modules unrelated to management tasks (e.g., unnecessary social features) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations or visualizations that slow down the interface). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating business logic/UI/data access layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching suitable for a business application (professional, not flashy) 2) Proper layout spacing with consistent dashboard grid systems 3) Professional typography with clear hierarchy (titles, subtitles, body text, captions). Deduct 3 points for each cluttered screen, 5 points for inconsistent design language across modules, and 5 points for poor information hierarchy. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and responsive for management workflows?
checklist.description: Judge whether the interface responds appropriately to executive-level user needs: 1) Quick access to high-level KPIs and metrics 2) Efficient drill-down capabilities from summary to detail views 3) Responsive design that works well on both desktop and tablet devices. Deduct 5 points for slow-loading dashboards (>2 seconds), 3 points for cumbersome multi-step workflows that could be simplified, and 5 points for lack of contextual help or onboarding for complex features. The full score is 10 points.
